channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Strategizing with AI: How leaders can upgrade strategic planning with multi-agent platforms
item.description: GenAI platforms can help organizations acclimate to an environment of higher-frequency change and adaptation.

item.title: Another Day, Another Chatbot’s Nazi Meltdown
item.description: The folks at X say don’t worry; they’re on it.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says Trump was ‘right to chicken out’ on tariffs, but that markets are getting too complacent
item.description: Jamie Dimon warns markets are growing complacent on Trump’s tariff threats, as UBS's Paul Donovan flags a paradox fueling investor overconfidence.

item.title: Over 30 million homeowners don’t have a mortgage right now. Here’s why that’s a big warning sign about the housing market
item.description: Homeowners also aren’t borrowing against their homes because interest rates are too high.

item.title: How Netanyahu Prolonged the Gaza War, and the F.B.I.’s Loyalty Test
Behind Trump’s Decision to Tax Brazil to Save Bolsonaro
item.description: Right-wing Brazilians wanted sanctions against the judge prosecuting Brazil’s former president. President Trump opted for something far bigger — tarif...

item.title: In Trumpworld, the stock markets say that tomorrow never comes
item.description: Thus the markets remain buoyant despite the apparent dangers.

item.title: The CEO of startup Rilla gives his employees up to $1,500 a month to live closer to the office—But there’s a catch
item.description: This startup founder is willing to help workers pay for housing if they’re willing to work 70 hours per week in person.

item.title: Trumps to Visit Texas Flood Sites, Where Search for Missing and Dead Continues
item.description: The president and the first lady were set to tour areas devastated by flooding in Central Texas. The administration has faced scrutiny over its level ...

item.title: Behind Trump’s Decision to Tax Brazil to Save Bolsonaro
item.description: Right-wing Brazilians wanted sanctions against the judge prosecuting Brazil’s former president. President Trump opted for something far bigger — tarif...

item.title: How This River in Thailand Was Poisoned
item.description: Unregulated heavy rare earth mining in war-torn Myanmar is poisoning the Kok River in Thailand. Hannah Beech, a New York Times reporter based in Bangk...

item.title: How James Gunn Modeled Superman’s Dog Krypto After His Own Pet
item.description: For the furry sidekick, Krypto, in “Superman,” the director James Gunn found inspiration — and a physical model — in his own unruly pet.

item.title: Takeaways From the Times Investigation Into Benjamin Netanyahu
item.description: Prolonging the Gaza war helped the Israeli prime minister forestall a political reckoning.

item.title: Trump’s Seesawing on Tariffs Gives the World Whiplash
item.description: Blunt letters dictating terms posted to social media and changes late in negotiations have left trading partners wondering what President Trump will d...

item.title: Manitoba Declares Second Wildfire Emergency in a Near-Record Year
item.description: The amount of land burned this year is on pace to be the most since 1994, as 100 blazes burned on Friday across the central Canadian province.
